alert.note: Alert for Berkeley; Charleston (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 01 at 10:52PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Berkeley and Charleston. * WHEN...Until midnight EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1048 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Rainfall rates have diminished considerably across the advisory area. However, moderate to occasionally heavy rain continues across Johns Island, James Island, Downtown Charleston, and Mount Pleasant. High tide is currently peaking so any ongoing flooding will continue until both the rainfall ends and the tide begins to recede. Through midnight, up to an additional 1 inch of rain will be possible, mainly from around Johns Island to Mount Pleasant. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... North Charleston, Mount Pleasant, James Island, Fort Sumter, Downtown Charleston, Daniel Island, West Ashley, Johns Island, Isle Of Palms, Folly Beach, Sullivan`s Island, Seabrook Island, Kiawah Island, Fort Johnson, James Island County Park, Sullivans Island, Maybank Bridge, Charles Towne Landing and Charleston Naval Complex.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report flooding directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 1-888-383-2024 or email your reports to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
